content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Locate a round-trip flight from Buenos Aires to Beijing, leaving on May 28, 2026, and returning on June 3, 2026, check out one of the options and tell me if the airline for my return flight is the same as my departure flight.  Please interact with https://www.google.com/travel/flights/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to enter "Buenos Aires" as the departure city and "Beijing" as the destination city. The textbox for the 'Where from?' field is labeled 13, so I'll start by updating this to "Buenos Aires".

Action: Type 13; Buenos Aires
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The departure city is now set to "Buenos Aires". Next, I need to input "Beijing" as the destination city into the 'Where to?' field, which is labeled 14.

Action: Type 14; Beijing
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The destination city is now set to "Beijing." The next step is to select the departure date (May 28, 2026). The 'Departure' date field is labeled 16, so I should interact with it next.

Action: Click 16
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The date picker is currently showing September and October, but I need to select May 28, 2026. I need to navigate forward in the calendar to reach May 2026. The "Next" button to move the calendar forward is labeled 74.

Action: Click 74
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar currently shows October and November. Since I need to select May 2026, I must keep navigating forward using the "Next" button, which is now labeled 75.

Action: Click 75
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.37
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows November and December. I still need to reach May 2026, which requires several more forward navigations. I will continue by clicking the "Next" button, labeled 75.

Action: Click 75
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.38
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now displays December 2025 and January 2026. I need to reach May 2026, so several more "Next" clicks are required. The "Next" button is now labeled 76.

Action: Click 76
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now displays January and February 2026. I am still a few months away from May 2026, so I need to continue clicking the "Next" button labeled 73.

Action: Click 73
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar currently shows February and March 2026. I need to reach May 2026, so I should keep moving forward by clicking the "Next" button, now labeled 73.

Action: Click 73
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows March and April 2026. I need to go forward one more time to reach May 2026. The "Next" button is labeled 75.

Action: Click 75
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now displays May 2026. I need to select May 28 as the departure date. May 28 is labeled as 70 on the calendar.

Action: Click 70
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The departure date is now set to May 28, 2026. Next, I need to select the return date of June 3, 2026. However, the calendar currently only displays up to May 2026. I need to navigate forward to display June 2026 using the "Next" button labeled 78.

Action: Click 78
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows June 2026. I need to select June 3 as the return date. The number "3" for June is labeled as 49.

Action: Click 49
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The departure (May 28, 2026) and return (June 3, 2026) dates are now both selected. Next, I should finalize my selection by clicking the "Done" button, which is labeled 81, to begin searching for flights that match these dates.

Action: Click 81
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: All necessary fields (origin, destination, departure, and return dates) are correctly set for the flight search. The next step is to initiate the search to display the available flight options by clicking the "Search" button, which is labeled 22.

Action: Click 22
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The flight search results are displayed, and I see multiple round-trip flight options from Buenos Aires to Beijing, with summary details (e.g., airlines, times, stops). To check if the airline for the return flight matches the departure, I need specific flight details for at least one flight. The first option uses Ethiopian Airlines, and I can get more info by clicking the "Flight details" button labeled 50.

Action: Click 50
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.9
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot provides details for the departing flight but does not display the airline for the return flight. To determine if the airline is the same for both departure and return, I need to scroll down to view the return flight details within this selected option.

Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.93

content:
Thought: The screenshot shows detailed segments for the outbound flight from Buenos Aires to Beijing, all operated by Ethiopian Airlines. However, there’s still no information shown for the return leg of the round-trip. I need to scroll further down to see details about the return flight and check its airline.

Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.95

content:
Thought: The screenshot now shows additional round-trip flight options, but there are no return flight details visible for the flight option I selected earlier (the one operated by Ethiopian Airlines). The detailed view for the Ethiopian Airlines flight was at the top of this screenshot, but it still only showed departure segments (not the return leg). To verify the airline for the return segment, I need to expand the details for the round-trip flight (most likely there’s an expandable menu/arrow for the detailed itinerary). The down-arrow button (expand details) for the Ethiopian flight at the top is not visible, possibly just off screen or rolled up; I need to scroll up to locate it.

Action: Scroll WINDOW; up
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.96

Thought: The display is back to showing details on the outbound (Buenos Aires to Beijing) journey with segments, all operated by Ethiopian Airlines. There is still no information regarding the return (Beijing to Buenos Aires) flight segment. Typically, flight result interfaces provide a way to expand further details or switch to view the return itinerary. There may be a tab, arrow, or more details button below or above this segment.

Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.97
